Our RSA server uses primes where p and q are both congruent to 3 mod 4 (Blum integers). Can you recover the flag from this oversight? Ciphertext: 4490667775578053231058016209713770733625629312248498027688402281088674088223034560926657813495361755512936742495757090095891166490606012772598669166953152

The flag format is flag{...}
n=4798635477893954749243710114108321378464143478371276756278275984165715234730688653366988978494036802214155099644548591483940932535193332153864672375806469, e=743174505622411961968073038869107287147594861675079986694763340996022693951318051425492232637724068414778676441652648146777092078744670315690866301018221
The lower 104 bits of p are: 53323518083710619181868689405836525247


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{hqe4zntd}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 4490667775578053231058016209713770733625629312248498027688402281088674088223034560926657813495361755512936742495757090095891166490606012772598669166953152
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=4798635477893954749243710114108321378464143478371276756278275984165715234730688653366988978494036802214155099644548591483940932535193332153864672375806469, e=743174505622411961968073038869107287147594861675079986694763340996022693951318051425492232637724068414778676441652648146777092078744670315690866301018221
The lower 104 bits of p are: 53323518083710619181868689405836525247

extra_info: p=66350880170995983875392447244022393335044876829329116077020623813479667334847, q=72322107340960132684517364756290769721113011413247839936465672615726041504827, Ï†(n)=4798635477893954749243710114108321378464143478371276756278275984165715234730549980379477022377476892402154786481492433595698355579179845857435466666966796
